name: MFSec blog.
body:
# New website?
Welcome humble mindfuck, welcome to one of the many sites that would probably turn into nothing, unless it does.

This site is an intended space for a group of friends mainly, which are considered but not limited to: security enthusiasts, hackers wannabe, sysadmins, and developers.

The main purpose of this site is to have a pulic space where they will try to share their ideas, experiencies, and whatever pops up into their head.

## MFProjects
We're actually going to share some of our projects, that may be of good public use.

## MFUsers
Since we're a lot, and since github provides us with the means to do it, each member can create it's on github page inside, having their own subdomain redirected to their page.

## Why?
I'm kind of tired at the moment but we've bought the domain for another year and didn't give it any good use, so now at least it has a visible, public page, which anyone inside the repository can edit.

So, yeah, that's basically it. 

Cheers,

Matt.
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
